page.title: 17THE CHANGING FACE OF PEEBLES
page.content: {Legend}has it that Peebles got its name from the white pebbles washed upon the banks of the{River Tweed during the summer months.The true meaning was formed from the Gaelic word{"Pebyl"}which means encampment.The King and his men used to come here and hunt.They made their encampment down a road now called Kingsmeadows. In the eyes of most people Peebles has improved.An old man we interviewed thinks Peebles has deteriorated because of the steady population growth over the years.He,though,has not seen the new buildings that have been built for our convenience. There used to be a railway in Peebles and its remains can be seen around Peebles.This apart,life in Peebles has changed only gradually.
